title: Monospaced round font
content:
Hello,  
im looking for a font that resembles T-STAR Mono Round or Gravur.  
Anyone got a good tip?

Thank you!
author: wahoo

comments.content:
Hi Thomas,

[Bryant](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414223531/http:/www.processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/bryant2/index.html) by [Eric Olson](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414223531/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Eric%20Olson)  
 [Chevin](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414223531/http:/www.identifont.com/show?BQY) by [Nick Cooke](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414223531/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Nick%20Cooke)  
 [Gotham Rounded](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414223531/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/font_overview.php?productLineID=100030) by [Hoefler & Frere-Jones](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414223531/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Hoefler%20%2526%20Frere-Jones)  
 [DIN 17](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414223531/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/efscangraphic/din-17-sb/) by Scangraphic  
FF DIN Round(ed) by [Albert-Jan Pool](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414223531/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Albert-Jan%20Pool) is in production.  
 [FF Magda Clean](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414223531/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_magda_clean/)  
 [Courier Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414223531/http:/www.lineto.com/The+Fonts/Font+Categories/Text+Fonts/Courier+Sans/) by [James Goggin](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414223531/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/James%20Goggin)  
 [Storno](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414223531/http:/www.lineto.com/The+Fonts/Font+Categories/Text+Fonts/Storno/) by [Elektrosmog](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414223531/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Elektrosmog)  
 [Typ 1451](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414223531/http:/www.lineto.com/The+Fonts/Font+Categories/Text+Fonts/Typ1451/) by [Nico Schweizer](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414223531/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Nico%20Schweizer)  
 [Gravostyle](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414223531/http:/www.optimo.ch/pages/departement/index.php?id_categorie=1&id_font=17) by [Niels Wehrspann](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414223531/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Niels%20Wehrspann)  
 [Hermes](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414223531/http:/www.optimo.ch/pages/departement/index.php?id_categorie=1&id_font=3) by [Gavillet & Rust](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414223531/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Gavillet%20%2526%20Rust)  
 [Pharma](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414223531/http:/www.optimo.ch/pages/departement/index.php?id_categorie=1&id_font=20) by [Julien Gaillardot](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414223531/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Julien%20Gaillardot)  
 [Simpliciter Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414223531/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/larstornqvist/simpliciter-sans/) by [Lars Törnqvist](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414223531/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Lars%20T%C3%B6rnqvist)  
 [Variable](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414223531/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/madtype/variable/) by [Matt Desmond](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414223531/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Matt%20Desmond)

and more [Rounded Typefaces](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414223531/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Rounded%20Typefaces)  
F

Hey Florian,

I have noticed that in a few threads you have posted amazing lists with URLs of different classes of fonts like the one above. This seems to be taken from a thread or list you have saved from Typophile or locally. I noticed it too on another thread regarding contemporary sans faces. I like your listings as they always seems to contain high quality faces - omitting the older more tired renditions.

Would you be willing to share this list with us or point me to the thread where you originally posted?

Jay

thank you a lot, very nice fonts you have listed.  
I am actually looking for a font almost exactly like T-Star mono, but can't use T-Star in the norwegian language, it lacks æ,ø,å in some variations. I want the look t-Star mono have, but need all glyphs. Im looking at Naiv, but this is maybe to playful..  
Thanks for all help, appreciate it.

- Thomas

Jay: I’m sorry I have to disappoint you: there is no big master list.  
A number of special (or not-so-special) typeface genres come up here on typophile again and again.  
Some of them have been covered in [FontFeeds](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414223531/http:/www.fontshop.com/fontfeed/), like [The Extra Bold, Ultra Black Fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414223531/http:/www.fontshop.com/fontfeed/archives/extra-bold-ultra-black-fonts/) (see also [The Fat Font Fad List](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414223531/http:/www.typophile.com/node/42643)). Others, like scripts, contructivist Bauhaus-style typefaces or lined fonts can be browsed on [Bowfin Printworks](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414223531/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/). The [TypoWiki](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414223531/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/TypoWiki) has some lists, too.

I remembered that we already had 2 or 3 threads about this rounded tech thing and searched for [Gravur](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414223531/http:/www.google.com/search?q=site:typophile.com%20gravur) and [T-Star](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414223531/http:/www.google.com/search?q=site:typophile.com%20t-star), using this [favelet](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414223531/http:/typophile.com/node/12436).  
Thus, I compiled a little list of the alternatives mentioned there, plus some more that came to my mind.  
No magic involved, only a little help from TextExpander (a Mac app that helps to insert links etc., similar to Typinator or RapidoWrite).

Thomas: Why don’t do ask [Die Gestalten](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414223531/http:/www.gestalten.com/fonts/detail/?id=402881820693de75010693debc1600d3) or [Mika Mischler](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414223531/http:/www.binnenland.ch/)? What about T-Star TW Pro?

Very nice Florian, T-Star TW Pro was exactly what I was looking for!  
Sent them an email, cant see where to buy it. Do you know if its open for sale?
Hey thanks Florian. I think I will start compiling a list of my own - starting with your nice list of rounded faces :)

Knock yourself out! :)  
If you want to share your compilations with others, consider adding them to the [Wiki](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414223531/http:/typophile.com/node/12270).
